website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive manual transmission fluid that provides a reduced friction level versus other similarly priced fluids.
pros: Transmission fluid that meets all requirements for Honda vehicles, but may be used on any vehicle
Will deliver a slight improvement in your overall fuel economy
Offers a better overall performance level than other similarly low-priced transmission fluids
cons: Might not work as well with non-Honda manual transmissions in terms of its longevity

customer_reviews.title: The *only* fluid that should ever go in your Honda manual transmission
customer_reviews.text: This is the ONLY fluid that should be going in your manual transmission if you care about your Honda! TIP* for those who want to do it yourself make sure your car is on a level surface and use a funnel with a tube to pour this into the filler hole on your transmission, you know its full once it starts dripping out the side. Very easy!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan James

customer_reviews.title: its the real deal
customer_reviews.text: Just to dispel some misinformation I found on here- gear oil is NOT suitable for Honda transmissions. 10w-30 motor oil was what was used in older Hondas before they came out with this. This fluid does perform better than regular motor oil. However, Honda mtf is not mandatory.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: clean an clear after almost 5 years and 50,000 miles
customer_reviews.text: I bought my car 4.5 years ago, and changed the tranny oil. It is a civic lx with the 1.7L engine and manual transmission. I have driven about 50,000 miles and decided to change the transmission oil after the axle broke. The fluid that came out of the transmission was just as clear, and clean as the fluid that went in after 4 years. There were no metal flakes, no burnt smell, it was still viscous, and looked new. I can't say much about the other stuff out there, but this has worked great, and I will continue to use it.
customer_reviews.author: savings monger

customer_reviews.title: 2001 Honda Prelude
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to change your transmission fluids! Even if it is a manual! Unlike me I didn't and now I might have to suffer the consequences. However! I'm going to run several passes with the MTF to get a good flush. 1st flush seemed to stop the grindings so far...(4/16/2016)
customer_reviews.author: Logan M Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Best in my humble opion.
customer_reviews.text: Been "Tinkering" with manual transmission fluids for many decades and have concluded the Honda fluid is the best for any manual transmission (no, I haven't tried it in all manufactures transmissions). Seems to provide the best friction for the syncros and and protects the gears at any temperature. I'm a manual transmission freak and all my cars have been and are manuals. I've experimented with many fluids including motor oil but this Honda fluid seems to me, to be the best at everything for manual transmissions.
customer_reviews.author: soaknewe (so can you)

customer_reviews.title: This is what is recommended for my 2011 Honda CRZ
customer_reviews.text: Genuine Honda fluid. This is what is recommended for my 2011 Honda CRZ. That is what I am going to use. $20 to change the trans fluid myself or take it to the dealer and let them do it for $100 or more, no thanks. I can handle that little job. I will be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie 70

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a must.
customer_reviews.text: So why’ll shifting I noticed it was a little ruff. If I stepped on it hard sometimes it wouldn’t wanna go into 2nd and sometimes 3rd. So I did some research and most forms said try replacing the transmission fluid. So far since I changed the fluid the car shifts a lot better. Ran the car hard and no problems with any of my gears. My car is roughly at 174,000 miles on it. And the transmission still running strong. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: trey

customer_reviews.title: Smooth shifting.
customer_reviews.text: After some research I opted to stay with Honda's MTF as opposed to Royal Purple or other competitors just to eliminate any potential problems. The vehicle I own could not be easier to change MTF in. All in all I think it took me 45 minutes and that included jacking my car up on stands and rotating my tires whilst I waited for the old MTF to drain. If you have even considered changing your MTF fluid (mine was 7-8 years old) do it. The new fluid made a world of difference. Gear changes are much smoother and the vehicle is just more enjoyable to drive.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: This stuff matters...
customer_reviews.text: There's something special about this fluid. It's tempting to "upgrade" to an aftermarket brand like RedLine, but this MTF makes for the smoothest transmission. Buy this. Stop researching other options!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan K. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Honda genuine parts
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Turned out I’ve been driving around with no manual transmission fluid. Added 2 quarts of the fluid and now my old 98 civic drives better than ever with over 330,000 miles. I’d recommend checking with your local dealer they may have it in stock at a cheaper price before buying on amazon. For me it was a few bucks cheaper from the dealer.
customer_reviews.author: Viniq

customer_reviews.title: Oem Honda, what's there to say.
customer_reviews.text: Just use what Honda intended... "Motor oil works, atf works, blah blah blah...." Why bother messing around and risk your tranny? Just buy the right stuff and do the job correctly the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Jimi

customer_reviews.title: Jitter and smoothness of my shifting didn't seem like a problem until I changed the fluid
customer_reviews.text: If you haven't done manual transmission fluid change in a while... it will most likely make a difference. Jitter and smoothness of my shifting didn't seem like a problem until I changed the fluid. Feels like a car off the lot.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat factory fluid!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this fluid for my new to me 08 accord coupe 5 speed, I read great things about this fluid. I first ordered syncromesh fluid then decided to switch to the hoinda MTF instead after reading better reviews on it. Hoping it works great, it should I have no doubt. My 5 speed shifts pretty smooth but every once in awhile it's kind of hard to get into certain gears, it doesn't grind or anything but it can be kind of annoying, I believe this will smooth it out.
customer_reviews.author: Christophe Mclelland

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy and I have had no problems or warning lights ...
customer_reviews.text: My 2008 Honda Fit (base model, manual transmission) required new tranny fluid at ~65k miles. I purchased 2 quarts of this product along with a manual fluid pump (linked below) and followed an online video to replace the fluid myself. It was very easy and I have had no problems or warning lights from the vehicle since. Much cheaper than taking it into the shop. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jared and Callie

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: First gear does not give me problems anymore! It goes in easy! I was told by the parts counter guy that this is not a syn blend and its no different then the original formula.. Im going to switch it to full syn next time. Update, I had amsoil syn 5w30 put in back in Jan 2016 and it seems a tad bit smoother. It was also 1 or 2 bucks cheaper than this.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pereira

customer_reviews.title: Fixed 2nd-3rd Gear Notchy Shift
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a 2007 Honda Civic Si and it was a little notchy getting into 3rd. So, I tried a short short adapter and shifter bushings but neither worked as well as this stuff did. I changed the fluid and after driving the carfor a few days, I can say that this stuff really works!
customer_reviews.author: CarTuned

customer_reviews.title: One of the OEM things I'll continue to use.
customer_reviews.text: I've heard of people using redline, or other brands. I've had no issues with the Honda MTF, so I'll keep using the OEM. Smells a little, but not like gear oil.
customer_reviews.author: Turbo Steve

customer_reviews.title: the good stuff
customer_reviews.text: This is what you want in your honda transmission. Shifts great, no problems. Comes free with that wonderful gear oil smell we all know and love
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S Bolton

customer_reviews.title: It's the right stuff.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Cheaper at the dealer but I didn't have to go get it. ProTip : Don't remove the fill plug unless the car is level.
customer_reviews.author: Fat Sean

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine in a 1993 Del Sol. The original fluid had not been changed after 25 years (94.000 original miles) so anything would have been an improvement. Is this product better than regular 10-30? No idea.
customer_reviews.author: A. Chace

customer_reviews.title: No problems with my AP1 S2000
customer_reviews.text: Decided to get this for maintenance on my AP1 S2000. Didn't notice much of a difference, if any. So I guess it's good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: BrandT

customer_reviews.title: Some good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a Honda OEM product. Compared it to one I previously bought at a dealership (which was pretty $$) will be getting it from Amazon now. Does what it's suppose to on my 07 5-speed manual accord.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: cant go wrong with genuine honda fluids.
customer_reviews.text: theres nothing bad to say about it. it made my gear changes a bit more smooth. but its not going to make it super noticeably better.
customer_reviews.author: Shoparuu

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Best price that I could find and exactly what was needed. It’s daily cheap so I’ll be changing it every 25k miles on my 2018 Honda Civic SI.
customer_reviews.author: Cong

customer_reviews.title: 2011 Honda CRZ - 6spd
customer_reviews.text: I used 2 of these to change the transmission fluid on my car. No complaints. Will purchase again when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: C.M

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased off of Amazon for less than the dealer for a 2001 Civic EX. Shifts super smooth and I would highly recommend doing the job yourself. I watched a video on Youtube and it probably took 20 minutes total. If you know righty tighty, lefty loosie, and how to pump fluid out of a bottle you're good!
customer_reviews.author: mary c korell

customer_reviews.title: Great Fluid, might be too expensive on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Once again I'm a slave to Prime. I can get this stuff for about half the cost at the dealer but I didn't want to make the trek. IMO this is the ONLY fluid I would run in my Civic Si. I'm going to edit this review and interject that they have lowered the price since I bought it, I paid almost 11.00 a bottle direct from Amazon but the price is now listed at less than 8.00 which is more in line with what the dealer charges.
customer_reviews.author: Jon S

customer_reviews.title: Give your honda what it needs, prolong your drivetrain!
customer_reviews.text: It works and its OEM, so no worries about long term use. Cheaper than my local dealer as well. Other than engine oil, I usually buy OEM fluids as you dont have to worry about long term issues like the whole dex-cool debacle.
customer_reviews.author: A. Georgeadis

customer_reviews.title: Better performance and notably quieter
customer_reviews.text: Changed the Manual Transmission Fluid in my 2003 Accord and to my surprise runs quieter on the highway. Recommend buying a hand pump to pump out of the quart into the trans -made it very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Does what its supposed to
customer_reviews.text: No noticeable difference in shifting quality, but then again didn't have a problem to start with. You will need a little more than 3 quarts for 1995 2.2 accord
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: great product, smooth shifting!! Just FYI 97 civic hx manual transmission oil capacity is 2.3 quarts.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfguy

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Honda oil arrived
customer_reviews.text: I received Genuine Honda MTF. 200,000 miles on the original oil, let's see if I can get another 200k.
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: It is original honda mtf (manual transmission fluid), but i found out my actual dealer sold for 7 a quart, not 11 on here.
customer_reviews.author: Soullessspirit

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what was purchased
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what i needed for changing a 2001 Honda Civic EX Coupe 5spd clutch. New clutch kit, flywheel, etc and new fluid
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great for CR-Z 6mt
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my Honda CR-Z. It’s thin like unlike the heavier 90w gear fluids that some owners use and swear by, but my gearbox shifts a lot smoother after this recent change.
customer_reviews.author: James Esquire

customer_reviews.title: Good OEM stuff
customer_reviews.text: Good OEM stuff would be a five star but took 8days when it was on prime.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Saavedra

customer_reviews.title: Great Fluid, Compares Equally with More Expensive Redline Full Synthetic Fluid
customer_reviews.text: I've run this Honda specific MTF, and Redline Full synthetic gear oil (I think I had 85W-140, but I don't remember) in my civic 5 speed. Comparing the two, this was half the price ($20 vs $40 for 2 quarts worth), and the shift quality with the Honda fluid is very good. I'd suggest changing your transmission oil every 30k miles to be on the safe side, considering its really cheap and makes your shifts nice and smooth once again. I've never had any issues with metal flakes or grinding with either fluid, so they both work well. Honda's fluid does have the benefit of being formulated for Honda cars, so that may give you a sense of insurance.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan P.Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up for OEM fluid
customer_reviews.text: Received the product as described. Thumbs up for cost and quick shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Vang

customer_reviews.title: Does what's expected!
customer_reviews.text: Hoping for a discount on purchasing oem product. But it's all good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really improved the feel of a 6MT S2000 shifter. Go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest place for Honda Genuine ATF
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper than at the dealership, customer is happy with transmission state more than a month post-install.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Gallion

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well with a 2009 Fit and shifting was improved.
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well with a 2009 Fit and shifting was improved.
customer_reviews.author: Pangloss

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Transmission had a little less trouble getting into reverse after changing the fluid.
customer_reviews.author: bk689

customer_reviews.title: it's awesome. It takes a few dozen shifts to work ...
customer_reviews.text: I put this in a Miata 5-speed trans. What a difference in shift smoothness, it's awesome. It takes a few dozen shifts to work its way into all the synchros. However realize this lube is REALLY thin, like brake fluid. So if you're racing, I'd think it gives less gear wear protection than the specified 85W90 gear oil.
customer_reviews.author: W. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Trust oem
customer_reviews.text: Reduces notchiness in my s2000. Only thing better is probably amsoil
customer_reviews.author: Phamo

customer_reviews.title: This didn't make my transmission feel like butter or shift any softer
customer_reviews.text: don't know what all the fuss is about. used this for my 1995 integra GSR. Either this or regular 10W-30 or 10W-40 engine oil would've worked for the transmission. This didn't make my transmission feel like butter or shift any softer. Personally think 10w-30 engine oil would've been better.
customer_reviews.author: balto113

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The right fluid to use for Honda manual transmissions. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Schrader

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should.
customer_reviews.text: Works great as it should. If you are buying this you hopefully know what it's for and how well it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Improves shifting
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 1995 Mazda Miata and my 2002 Honda S2000. The Honda S2000 is okay but the shifting in my Miata has improved greatly.
customer_reviews.author: ipitydafool

customer_reviews.title: 1993 honda del sol si
customer_reviews.text: had pretty bad grinding issues going into 2nd and 3rd on my Si del slow. swapping out w.e was in there with this stopped allll grinding issues. sadly i alrdy had issues popping out of 2nd as well as my ISB going out, which nothing can really save. but this did most def. stop my grinding issues. stick with honda OEM mtf and prolong the life on your transmissions, please.
customer_reviews.author: Jaspreet S Mushiana

customer_reviews.title: Honda MTF FTW
customer_reviews.text: Used this in my 2008 FA5 Civic Si sedan and the shifter went from notchy to SMOOTH AS GLASS. I'm surprised at how much of a difference it made. Don't forget to buy new crush washers for your fill plug and drain plug when you change it!!
customer_reviews.author: r3t1awr3yd

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Genuine Honda product good quality. Arrived on time in adequate packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Twisted beard

customer_reviews.title: There is a temptation to use third party fluids because of the perception they are more high tech but this fluid really is the b
customer_reviews.text: Used in my S2000. There is a temptation to use third party fluids because of the perception they are more high tech but this fluid really is the best fit for your Honda gearbox. I swapped out fluid because the shifts were getting a little crunchy and with this Honda product, they are back to being silky smooth. I live in Florida so I wasn't concerned about cold weather performance.
customer_reviews.author: Oversteer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good GL4 fluid. Seems to improve my cold weather shifting in a Toyota Solara 19999 2.2L.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Chau

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: It seems like this is the best manual transmission fluid for the aging Honda. I put this in my 1999 Accord and it made a pleasant improvement in the gear shift. And it's reasonably priced too.
customer_reviews.author: jashber

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Fluid
customer_reviews.text: I have always been told to use Manufacturer specific fluids for your car. Well, it has never hurt me in the past, and this time was no different. Honda's will run for a really long time. They will run even longer if you treat them right. With this...the price was right and it works like a charm. The fluid I removed was not dirty. In fact...it appeared to have very low miles on it. I decided to change it just for piece of mind. Take care of your Honda and it will take care of you. Happy motoring.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 97 civic 5 speed. 20k miles now no issues at all

customer_reviews.text: Nothing beats OEM in terms of good oil for your transmission. This stuff is synthetic, but that's the only option from Honda now since they changed their formula, only negative part is this stuff is EXPENSIVE when your needing to buy the amount of oil your transmission needs.

Seems this one is good for daily drive car because it has better 1st and 2nd shifting, but after it gets hot, it lt shears down and 3rd, 4th shifting is not comfortable if you track your car, I recommend Red Line, Royal Purple or Castrol MTL which have better protection.

product_meta.title: Genuine Honda Fluid 08798-9031 Manual Transmission Fluid - 1 Quart
product_meta.description: Honda genuine fluids are the exact original equipment manufacturer (OEM) fluids that your vehicle came with. When you select a genuine OEM fluid - you can rely on the high quality and effectiveness of the product and brand without having to guess if the product will work in sequence with your vehicle. Protecting your investment is important and choosing the right fluids can be challenging. So don't risk another minute by searching and buying something that might work. Stick with what you know and choose a genuine OEM Honda fluid.
feature_bullets: Package Dimensions: 6.858 L x 22.352 H x 10.922 W (centimeters)
New and improved formula that meets quality standards
